title: LG UHD 164 cm (65 inch) Ultra HD (4K) LED Smart TV  (65UM7290PTD)

product_specification.In The Box: MANUAL, WARRANTY CARD: 1U CARD:3U REMOTE: 1U BATTERY:2 U
product_specification.Color: Ceramic BK and Dark Steel Silver
product_specification.Supported Video Formats: AVI, Blu-ray, DVD Video, MPEG, WAV, WMA
product_specification.Sound Mode: Standard, Cinema, Clear Voice III, Cricket, Music, Game
product_specification.Supported Audio Formats: AC4, AC3 (Dolby Digital), EAC3, HE-AAC, AAC, MP2, MP3, PCM, DTS, DTS-HD, DTS Express, WMA, APT-X (Refer to Manual)
product_specification.Other Audio Features: 15 Languages (English, French, Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, Vietnamese, Bulgarian, Russian, Maori, Ukrainian, Kazakh, Thai, Hebrew, Arab, Korean)
product_specification.Supported App - Others: Prime Videos, Zee5, Apple TV, Eros Now, AltBalaji, Voot
product_specification.Warranty Summary: 1 Year Comprehensive Warranty and Additional 1 Year Warranty is Applicable on Panel only. (Offer valid till 30 - April - 2022)
product_specification.Covered in Warranty: Warranty of the Product is Limited to Manufacturing Defects Only
product_specification.Not Covered in Warranty: Warranty does not Cover Any External Accessories (Such as Battery, Cable, Carrying Bag), Damage Caused to the Product due to Improper Installation by Customer, Normal Wear and Tear to Magnetic Heads, Audio, Video, Laser Pick-ups and TV Picture Tubes, Panel, Damages Caused to the Product by Accident, Lightening, Ingress of Water, Fire, Dropping or Excessive Shock, Any Damage Caused due to Tampering of the Product by An Unauthorised Agent, Liability for Loss of Data, Recorded Images or Business Opportunity Loss
product_specification.Installation & Demo Details: This product does not require installation. The features of the product are presented in the user manual that comes with it. Hence, the manufacturer does not provide on-site installation or demo for the product. In case of any queries about the installation or the features of product, kindly call us at 1800 208 9898 or (080) 49400000 for assistance.

product_description.4K Resolution Images: This LG TV offers high definition, rich detail, and vivid visuals on its 4K IPS display.
product_description.Quad-core Processor: The powerful quad-core processor offers fast processing, eliminates noise, and delivers vivid colors, and impressive contrast. It also upscales the low-resolution images to provide a sharp and vivid visual experience.

•Picture quality --->
1. If you are playing native 4k uhd videos through USB or HDMI , it gonna blow your mind...4k videos are looking crystal sharp & supreme colour accuracy.

2. If you are using set top box or DTH(majority of us are doing so) then do subscribe to the HD channels of the broadcaster. Because if you play a SD channel on this 4k screen the image output looks messy just for the vigorous upscaling. But in the other hand when you play a HD channels , TV needs to work less on upscaling. Then you can realise how much your TV can.
NOTE 1: The upscaling of LG is very good (better than samsung wondertainment series)

•Audio quality --->
Before placing order i was worried about the term 20W 😅... because now a days some bt speakers are coming with more than RMS output of that. But LG provides various audio presets...they are better than my experience...i hardly could bump up the volume over 55%😅. So don't just see that #20W😅✌🏻.

Audio experience = 5/5


•LG installation---
I placed order = 20th March
It has been delivered = 22nd march (10am)
It has been installed = 22nd march (2pm) *wall bracket is free of cost.


Note 3 --> you will not get magic remote out of the box , you have to buy it seperately.


Don't hesitate place the order.

Thanks to flipkart & LG 😁

First of all, blazing fast delivery by Flipkart. Delivered in less than a day. Installation and demo provided by LG within an hour from delivery. So hats off to LG support.
Flipkart provided open box delivery option to verify any physical damage to the product.
About the TV:
1. A rather lengthy setup process but justifiable given all the features packed into it. Additional setup for Apple Airplay.
2. OS required an update. After the update the UI is absolutely fluid. UI is intuitive, clutter free and crisp.
3. The display is very well lit and bright enough. Great viewing angles. Impeccable picture quality.
4. Sound output seemed rather timid. Could have been much better. Lacks that bass.
5. There a lot of other options from newer brands offering better specs, but those will barely make a difference for an everyday user experience. Plus LG offers great customer service.
Overall a great value for money product.

Pros:
1. It is DLED (Direct LED) which doesn't have any screen bleeding issues (White patches on the edges of the screen) like the ELED (Edge LED)
2. 4K upscaling is doing decent work.
3. Works with 4TB external drives
4. Supreme color accuracy and image quality. Thanks to Active HDR mode
5. Decent speakers with DTS/DOLBY sound. No need to buy a home theater if you are not a music lover.
6. Apps response is smooth and fast. Hazel free UI.
7. More connection ports


Cons:
1. The panel is not IPS. The panel technology in this model named as "Ultra Bright Panel"
2. Magic remote (for voice commands) needs to be purchased separately at extra cost 2k. But there is NO STOCK !!
3. No bezel-less design
4. Plastic stand
------------------------
overall rating 3/5

Let's get a couple of things straight.
1. I'm generally too lazy to write a comprehensive review and
2. I had an older, 32 inch LG LCD and my experience was terrible. I wanted to try it ONLY BECAUSE of my possible future purchase of an OLED. I wanted to choose between LG and Sony. I have a Sony full HD LED, purchased about three years ago.

I was queasy about LG, and wanted to opt for something without 'brand value' as this buy was supposed to be a budget option. After constant searches and moments of indecision, I decided to opt for this one for the price and the added 10% off on HDFC cards as Republic Day sale was on.

I was COMPLETELY ready to be underwhelmed; but my oh my! I couldn't BELIEVE my eyes as what I saw in terms of picture output was beyond satisfactory! The 4K is spectacular, and so is the FHD. The upscaling could use some work, and so does the audio, but DO CONSIDER the brand value AND the price point! The panel is uniform, there's no uneven backlight bleed, the black is as black as it should be on a panel of this range. I'm too lazy to append pics, but as a verified user please take my word for it. The picture output is beautiful PROVIDED you give the unit some time to 'break in', as it were. The overall viewing experience now is significantly better than what it was when it was first installed. Give it time.
You have PLENTY of connectivity options, and the 2.5 Ghz bandwidth works like a charm. Just get yourself a good router and you'll see. The unit is also extremely helpful in making sense of the cluttered file system of my ext. HDD which I was SURE it won't play, as there were so many different kinds of files. But it did. The responsiveness is something you need to feel to understand.

Con? Well, that HAS to be the remote. The magic remote is no longer easily available (I have this impression that it's not available AT ALL) and if you want to experiment with internet and Netflix and other streaming services, well...you'd be in for BIG trouble. Using the remote that comes bundled with the unit is a...profound pain in the rear!

Nothing else, really. It has been a fantastic purchase, a decision that I take pride in! LG 43UM7290PTF is one stunning piece of TV unit (considering the price point; NEVER forget that most important bit while being judgmental) and you won't repent the decision of opting for it!

We have used this product for about a month and we are already regretting the purchase.
1. The remote stops working at random. I have changed the batteries a few times already and it has a mood of its own, and would only work when it likes.
2. It does not "cast" everything. The only app it works with is YouTube. Even though it can "screen cast" from some phones, it does not do it from individual apps, for example, Prime Video, Netflix, Hotstar, etc.
3. The sound is poor. You can't hear anything. We probably will end up buying a soundbar.
4. Even this early in its life, the WiFi connection is poor. While all the devices at home remain connected, it fails to connect often. We had an LG TV abroad, and it had the same issue. That was 4 years ago and I thought they would have fixed after all this upgrade iterations.
5. The only plus is its picture quality. It is immaculate, and 4K videos are a spectacle. But it will be like watching a silent movie as you won't hear a thing.

Awesome TV. I had to do an upgrade from the VU 50-inch tv I was using since 2014 and I went with this LG TV. I am writing this review after using it for almost a month now.

Pros:
• Good viewing angles
• Sleek Navigation
• All major OTT app works like a charm.
• Picture quality is great and should satisfy most of the viewers but don't expect an OLED sort of clarity or definition in the picture.
• Sound quality is good and there are options to use it along with a soundbar or AV receiver.
• The biggest plus point that I see is getting cinematic sound like the latest Dolby ATMOS, I use a Philips TAPB603 Atmos soundbar.
• I got a 4k Firestick and I use them for watching movies from Netflix. I could never extract atmos sound effect until started using this TV. 4K Firestick, when connecting to TV or soundbar has given me only 5.1 effects. But using the TV’s Netflix app I was able to get the Atmos effect.SO yes, u can get Dolby Atmos pass-through from this TV using HDMI arc to an Atmos content Supported Soundbar/AV receiver which can decode Atmos content.
• Bluetooth works fine, casting works fine


Cons:

• There are some times where we get a feeling that video quality is lacking
• Picture quality- we can select many picture modes like vivid, standard, etc. but I see that apart from vivid and standard all other modes adds a strong yellow color to the screen.

This is an great value for money TV. I bought a 43 inch version and 2 year additional warranty from LG @ INR 3213. I had some issues with casting using mobile but then I observed that once you restart the mobile casting works fine. Web OS is better than Android when it comes to ease of use and response lag time but has fewer apps. If you are looking for a large no of apps then this TV isn't for you. There is a clear difference when you are using webos apps. The video quality in web os apps is much more clear than casting or using cable. Sony Liv app works fine on this tv. Viewing angles are great. Sound is fine if you are not a music buff or using it in a small room. Base is low. We are using it in a 10*12 room. I feel that there is no need for a magic remote as the lg thinQ app works great. There might be minor issues here and there, for eg., one or two times the lg thinQ app stopped responding but most of the time I had no issues. I would like to add that this is my first led tv. My only previous experience with led screens was with a Dell monitor bought in 2017 and laptops. So please take this review with a pinch of salt. And would like to applaud the LG team for prompt installation. The Flipkart delivery guy did a good job too. Thank you LG and Flipkart for a glitch free experience.

Firstly, on the logistical part- The product got delivered in one day and the installation happened on the very next day. Happy for that and also the technician from LG is professional and had the patience to listen to my requirements and Demo also went well. 100% happy on delivery and installation.

Coming to the TV spec- My initial choice was to go with budgeted TV in 4k- I almost bumped to purchase MI 4k TV or Motorola during the Dasara sale. But after thorough research, I decided to go with a branded one.

The product is very good and the 4k video plays very smoothly with precision.

As many people said, yes the magic remote doesn't come with this product but however, the TV does support it and I have downloaded the App. or you can buy for around 900Rs.

The product came with 3 years warranty (1+2) and on top, I took an additional 2 years warranty from LG for 3K which makes 5 years hassle-free experience.

My rating-

Video 4.5/5 ( considering the price) . Yes, Even the latest LG which priced around 45-50K also use the same panel.
Sound - 4/5 it comes with 20 watts and I think is more than enough.
Warranty - 5/5 ( a few extra amount on AMC makes life easy )
OS- 4/5 this is the only thing that might be a con. there are quite a few apps that are not available right now ( like MX player etc).

Pros:

Video clarity ( Pls don't compare with Sony or any QLED) but in the 40k segment, I think this is the best in the market.
LG brand
Post-service
Magic remote ( easy to play around)

Cons:
Doesn't come with a magic remote. Need to buy separately
Web OS ( not exactly a big con but few apps are missing)

Overall- If your budget permits and wants a true decent 4K experience then one can go with this TV
